Class InputMethods

java.lang.Object
InputMethods
public class InputMethods extends Object
Input Method Class The class is used to pass methods to request valid input input is then handled along with potential errors
Version:
1.00, 27 July 2021
Author:
Chris Joubert

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static String
    getPostalCode​(String tempPersonType)
    Get Postal Code Request Method
    The method requests the user enter a 4 digit South African postal code The input is cast to an int before being returned to confirm all values are numeric
    static int
    getSearchIndex​(int[] arrayToSearch, String[] arrayOptionToDisplay)
    Get Search Index
    The method requests user input and filters the passed array to for value that match the user input If an int array is passed to search, the int array is cast to a string array first.

    Get Search Index
    The method requests user input and filters the passed array to for value that match the user input

    Get User Choice Method
    The method requests the user confirm of decline with a "Yes" or "No" question
    static String
    getUserString​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay)
    Get User String Request Method
    The method requests the user enter a String Value, without a pre-filled value in the input field The method also confirms the string does not contain certain special characters and returns an error if one is detected

    Get User String Request Method
    The method requests the user enter a String Value, with a pre-filled value in the input field The method also confirms the string does not contain certain special characters and returns an error if one is detected

      public InputMethods()

  • Method Details

    • getValidBigDecimal

      public static BigDecimal getValidBigDecimal​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay)
      Get User BigDecimal Request Method
      The method requests the user enter a BigDecimal Value, with no pre-filled value in the input field The values are passed to the BigDecimal method with the "pre-filled value" set to blank
      Parameters:
      valueToRequest - String to display when requesting input from the user
      errorToDisplay - String to display if an invalid entry is detected
      Returns:
      BigDecimal value entered by user or -1 if the user canceled
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      getValidBigDecimal(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

    • getValidBigDecimal

      public static BigDecimal getValidBigDecimal​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay, String prefilledValue)
      Get User BigDecimal Request Method
      The method requests the user to enter a BigDecimal Value, with a pre-filled value in the input field
      Parameters:
      valueToRequest - String to display when requesting input from the user
      errorToDisplay - String to display if an invalid entry is detected
      prefilledValue - String to pre-fill when requesting user input
      Returns:
      BigDecimal value entered by user or -1 if the user canceled
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • getValidInt

      public static int getValidInt​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay)
      Get User Int Request Method
      The method requests the user enter an Int Value, with no pre-filled value in the input field
      Parameters:
      valueToRequest - String to display when requesting input from the user
      errorToDisplay - String to display if an invalid entry is detected
      Returns:
      Int value entered by user or -1 if the user canceled
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      getValidInt(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

    • getValidInt

      public static int getValidInt​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay, String prefilledValue)
      Get User Int Request Method
      The method requests the user enter a positive Int Value, with a pre-filled value in the input field
      Parameters:
      valueToRequest - String to display when requesting input from the user
      errorToDisplay - String to display if an invalid entry is detected
      prefilledValue - String to pre-fill when requesting user input
      Returns:
      Int value entered by user or -1 if the user canceled
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • getUserString

      public static String getUserString​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay)
      Get User String Request Method
      The method requests the user enter a String Value, without a pre-filled value in the input field The method also confirms the string does not contain certain special characters and returns an error if one is detected
      Parameters:
      valueToRequest - String to display when requesting input from the user
      errorToDisplay - String to display if an invalid entry is detected
      Returns:
      String value entered by user or "" if the user canceled entry
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      getUserString(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

    • getUserString

      public static String getUserString​(String valueToRequest, String errorToDisplay, String prefilledValue, String cancelMessage)
      Get User String Request Method
      The method requests the user enter a String Value, with a pre-filled value in the input field The method also confirms the string does not contain certain special characters and returns an error if one is detected
      Parameters:
      valueToRequest - String to display when requesting input from the user
      errorToDisplay - String to display if an invalid entry is detected
      prefilledValue - String to display as a pre-filled value
      cancelMessage - String to display if the user selects to cancel entry
      Returns:
      String value entered by user or "" if the user canceled entry
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • getPostalCode

      public static String getPostalCode​(String tempPersonType)
      Get Postal Code Request Method
      The method requests the user enter a 4 digit South African postal code The input is cast to an int before being returned to confirm all values are numeric
      Parameters:
      tempPersonType - String to display when requesting input from the user
      Returns:
      String value entered by user or "" if the user canceled entry
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • getUserConfirmation

      public static boolean getUserConfirmation​(String messageToConfirm)
      Get User Choice Method
      The method requests the user confirm of decline with a "Yes" or "No" question
      Parameters:
      messageToConfirm - String to display when requesting a selection from the user
      Returns:
      Boolean, Selecting "Yes" returns True, selecting "No" returns False
      Since:
      version 1.00

    • getSearchIndex

      public static int getSearchIndex​(int[] arrayToSearch, String[] arrayOptionToDisplay)
      Get Search Index
      The method requests user input and filters the passed array to for value that match the user input If an int array is passed to search, the int array is cast to a string array first.
      Parameters:
      arrayToSearch - Int Array to cast to a string array and search for the users's matching input
      arrayOptionToDisplay - String Array to display as selection options for the user ( must match the arrayToSearch in length )
      Returns:
      Int pointing to the index of the user's selection from the search results ( -1 is returned if the user cancels )
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      getSearchIndex(int[],java.lang.String[])

    • getSearchIndex

      public static int getSearchIndex​(String[] arrayToSearch, String[] arrayOptionToDisplay)
      Get Search Index
      The method requests user input and filters the passed array to for value that match the user input
      Parameters:
      arrayToSearch - String Array to filter for the user's search request
      arrayOptionToDisplay - String Array to display as selection options for the user ( must match the arrayToSearch in length )
      Returns:
      Int pointing to the index of the user's selection from the search results ( -1 is returned if the user cancels )
      Since:
      version 1.00
      See Also:
      getSearchIndex(int[],java.lang.String[])
